alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Henry; Pittsylvania; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 5:15PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong storms will impact portions of eastern Rockingham, western Caswell, eastern Roanoke, southwestern Pittsylvania, Henry and Franklin Counties, the southwestern City of Danville, the City of Roanoke and the City of Martinsville through 545 PM EST... At 515 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong storms along a line extending from Callaway to near Chatmoss to near Monroeton. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke... Danville... Eden... Reidsville... Martinsville... Vinton... and Rocky Mount. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for north central North Carolina...and central and south central Virginia.
